attributes.action: keep fm radio transmissions and not force the UK to only have digital radio
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Gov intends to stop analogue radio by 2015 (6 years).  This will 1. make millions of radios obsolete creating waste, 2. force people to buy expensive digital radios to replace these 3. only provide coverage for 90% of UK (1 in 10 will loose radio!) 4. force changover of car radios to a scheme which doesn't work well in cars. 5. Force the elderly to embrace a technology with which they are unfamiliar. 
This is so that the government can free up airwaves to sell.  We want to keep analogue radio, which is easy to get, cheap to buy, and universally understood.
This change is detrimental to the UK population and needs resisting

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
